bill_title: exempt certain residential utilities from sales and use tax and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to exempt certain residential utilities from sales and use tax and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 10-45 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The gross receipts from the sale of special fuel as defined in subsection 10-47B-3(39)(b), liquid petroleum gas, compressed natural gas, or natural gas if used exclusively for heating of residential housing, including single-family and multi-family units, are exempt from the provisions of this chapter and the tax imposed by it. Section 2. That chapter 10-45 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The gross receipts from the sale of electricity if used exclusively for residential housing, including single-family and multi-family units, are exempt from the provisions of this chapter and the tax imposed by it. Section 3. That chapter 10-46 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The gross receipts from the sale of special fuel as defined in subsection 10-47B-3(39)(b), liquid petroleum gas, compressed natural gas, or natural gas if used exclusively for heating of residential housing, including single-family and multi-family units, are exempt from the provisions of this chapter and the tax imposed by it. Section 4. That chapter 10-46 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The gross receipts from the sale of electricity if used exclusively for residential housing, including single-family and multi-family units, are exempt from the provisions of this chapter and the tax imposed by it. Section 5. This Act is repealed on April 1, 2002. Section 6. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
